Utterance: Hi, welcome back! It's great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I've been okay, I guess. Just the usual ups and downs.
I understand. Last time, we talked a bit about your feelings of anger and sadness related to your ex-husband. Have those feelings changed at all?
Not really. I still feel angry when I think about him and the situation. It's hard to let go.
That makes sense. Anger can be a tough emotion to process. Have you found any coping strategies that help you manage those feelings?
I try to distract myself with music or spending time with my son, but it doesn’t always work.
It sounds like you're doing your best to cope. Would you be open to exploring some additional strategies together?
Sure, I’m open to that.
Great! One technique that might help is mindfulness. It can help you stay present and reduce feelings of anger. Have you ever tried mindfulness exercises?
I’ve heard of it but never really tried it.
Mindfulness can be as simple as focusing on your breath for a few minutes or observing your surroundings without judgment. Would you like to try a short exercise together now?
Okay, I can try that.
Alright, let's take a moment. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath in... and out. Focus on the sensation of your breath. Notice how your body feels with each inhale and exhale.
<pause> Okay, I’m doing that.
Good. If your mind wanders, gently bring your focus back to your breath. How does it feel to just focus on your breathing?
It's... calming, actually. I can feel my shoulders loosening a bit.
That’s wonderful to hear! Mindfulness can be a good tool for when you feel overwhelmed. How do you think you might incorporate it into your daily routine?
Maybe I could do it for a few minutes in the morning before the kids wake up.
That sounds like a great idea! Starting your day with mindfulness could set a positive tone. Would you be willing to try that this week?
Yeah, I’ll give it a shot.
Fantastic! Now, last time you mentioned feeling down and irritable. Have you noticed any patterns or triggers for those feelings since we last spoke?
I think it mostly happens when I think about my ex or when I’m really tired.
Sleep can definitely impact our mood. Have you been able to improve your sleep at all?
Not really. I still wake up a lot at night.
Have you considered any changes to your nighttime routine that might help with your sleep?
I haven’t really thought about it. I guess I just go to bed and hope for the best.
That’s understandable. Sometimes small changes can make a big difference. Would you be open to discussing a few strategies for improving your sleep?
Sure, I’d like that.
One strategy could be to establish a calming bedtime routine. This might include activities like reading, gentle stretching, or limiting screen time before bed. What do you think?
That sounds doable. I could try reading before bed instead of scrolling on my phone.
That’s a great idea! Reading can be a wonderful way to wind down. Let’s set that as a goal for this week.
Okay, I can do that.
Excellent! Now, you mentioned feeling proud of your son last time. How has he been doing?
He’s been great! We had a fun weekend together, just hanging out and playing games.
That sounds lovely! It’s wonderful to hear that you’re creating positive experiences together.
Yeah, it really helps me forget about everything else for a bit.
That’s important. Finding joy in those moments can be very healing. Have you had any other positive experiences or interactions with friends lately?
I did meet up with a friend for coffee last week. It was nice to talk and just relax.
That’s great! Social support is crucial. How did you feel after your coffee date?
I felt lighter, like I could breathe again.
That’s wonderful! It sounds like spending time with friends can really uplift your mood. Would you like to plan another social outing this week?
Yes, I think I need that. I’ll reach out to another friend.
Perfect! Connecting with others can help combat feelings of isolation.
I agree.
Before we wrap up, let’s review the goals we’ve set for this week. You’re going to try mindfulness in the morning, establish a calming bedtime routine, and plan a social outing. How does that sound?
That sounds manageable. I feel like I can do that.
I believe in you! Remember, it’s about progress, not perfection.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! I look forward to hearing how everything goes in our next session. Take care!
You too! Bye!
Bye!
